intro: Kayea ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty kayea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a slightly hairy surface. Kayea ferruginea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
